contentrichtext.text: {{multiple issues|unreferenced =December 2009|cleanup =March 2010|notability=June 2008}} <!--SCROLL DOWN IN ORDER TO EDIT THE ARTICLE--> {{Infobox PolishCoA| herb=Ossorya| image=Herb Ossorya.jpg| battlecry=Hosoryja, Osoryja, Szarza| alternative=Ossorija, Osorya, Poświt, Szarza, Sztarza| mention=14th century| families=60 names altogether: Billicki, Bochłowski, Bogdal, Boklewski, Boklowski, Bokłowski, Brochocki, Bukowski, Burzyński, Busz, Buszkowski, Ciepecki, Ciepicki, Ciepliński, Czeszyk, Dobiecki, Filipowski, Gordyk, Gordyka, Grabownicki, Hruszewicz, Kołomyjski, Konarski, Kondracki, Kondradzki, Konradzki, Korabiewski, Korabski, Kostecki, Kostrzecki, Krzesławski, Krzywoszewski, Kunradzki, Kurski, Kwasowski, Lasowski, Łaszewski, Martos, Metalski, Niepoczołowski, Niepoczołtowski, Pelwelski, Pierzczewski, Pieskowski, Ryterowski, Schleewitz, Sczaniecki, Stadnicki, Striżewski, Szczaniecki, Świeczka, Terawski, Twardzicki, Twerbus, Twierbut, Twirbut, Tworkowski, Tyrawski, Werbotych, Złotski| towns=none| }} '''Ossorya''' - is a [[Polish heraldry|Polish Coat of Arms]]. It was used by several [[szlachta]] families in the times of the [[Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth]]. ==History== <!--Here goes the history and the legend of the Coat of Arms--> {{Empty section|date=July 2010}} ==Blazon== {{Empty section|date=July 2010}} ==Notable bearers== Notable bearers of this Coat of Arms include: Wodecki * ==See also== * [[Polish heraldry]] * [[Heraldry]] * [[Coat of Arms]] {{Coats of arms of Polish families}} [[Category:Polish coats of arms]] {{poland-heraldry-stub}}
